bug.short_desc: Un-disabling addon version with admin control panel broken

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier:
If I try to enable an addon with the admin control panel then the status changes on the admin control panel page, but doesn't change on the review page (meaning the version can't then be approved, etc). The following day the version status was reset back to disabled.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Find an addon with a disabled version. (e.g. https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/admin/addons/status/10433) 2. change the status of the disabled version to 'awaiting preliminary review' 3. go to the review page associated with that version. Actual Results: review page status says 'disabled by mozilla' and submitting the form throws the normal error.
Expected Results: review page status says 'awaiting review' (or whatever the wording is); I'm able to approve/prelim/deny the version.
Has this happened to you more than once?

I just checked the review page for this add-on, and the status is correctly set to Pending Full Review. It could be that there's a delay from Admin changes to review pages, but everything appears to be working normally for now.
If the problem occurs again, or it takes more than an hour to update on review pages, please reopen this bug.
WFM
